docs.text: you've seen this moment before , recently : a particularly troubled character senses danger of the paranormal kind when the room temperature inexplicably plummets to below freezing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the difference is that when it happens to lili taylor's nell in the haunting , we don't care .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the hero of the sixth sense , a young boy named cole , is a rich creation , and we wish nothing more than for the ghosts who haunt him to take a hike .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the seasons have changed since an ex-patient shot jaded child psychologist malcolm crowe ( willis ) in the comfort of his own bedroom .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: desperate to get his career back on track , even at the expense of his crumbling marriage ( to williams , of rushmore ) , malcolm councils the deeply troubled cole ( osment ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the preteen displays all the quirks of malcolm's would-be killer : scars on his body ; antisocial behaviour ; and the reluctance to reveal a big secret .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: only after cole is locked in a closet by some bullies ( and hospitalized as a result ) does he divulge to malcolm , in a spine-tingling scene , that he sees dead people walking among us , all the time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: malcolm assumes , and given his profession , reasonably so , that cole is schizophrenic , not psychic , but the sincerity in cole's anguished confession prevents the doctor from taking drastic measures .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he will instead pursue the supernatural angle , becoming a kind of surrogate father to cole ( who lives with his single mother , lynn ( collette ) ) in the process .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the sixth sense has more in common with ghost than poltergeist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( though shyamalan does , somewhat unforgiveably , crib the self-rearranging kitchen business from the latter . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's far more heartwarming than frightening , and the film would be none the worse for wear without its few pulp shocks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cole attracts the dead for reasons unknown , but they're not out to harm him , really-they just want to be heard , even if it means scaring the bejesus out of the innocent gradeschooler .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps the apparitions seem more ghastly to us , at first , than they really are because we're looking at the situation through the eyes of an eight-year-old .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's right : willis , for the first time in years , gives up the spotlight to his costar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we appreciate malcolm's domestic dilemma , but we identify with cole , recalling our fears of the bogeyman or the closet monster or the thing under the bed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both actors deliver immensely likable performances , and their dynamic is manifest .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: willis convinces us that he's a doctor , something he was unable to do as a horndog shrink in the overheated color of night .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: osment is phenomenal , a true professional who resists mugging for the camera like some child stars with too much experience in television commercials do .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the sixth sense ( atmospherically shot by the silence of the lambs' cinematographer , tak fujimoto ) is actually a drama-its spooky , effective ad campaign is misleading .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: only because i was expecting something different did i notice-rather , feel-the movie's running time , which is just shy of two hours .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story unfurls slowly but engrossingly ; its unexpected finish is definitely worth the wait .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'm not sure said big twist ending is bulletproof , but i admired its audacity .
docs.label: positive
